description: Australia is “killing” the US aluminum market, a senior trade adviser to President Donald Trump said, in a potential blow to Prime Minister Anthony Albanese’s efforts to secure an exemption from tariffs that come into effect next month.
title: Australia Is ‘Killing’ US Aluminum Market, Trump Adviser Says

description: The White House barred an Associated Press reporter from covering an event with President Donald Trump and adviser Elon Musk on Tuesday, in what the longtime newswire said was punishment for its style guide not adopting the president’s new “Gulf of America” label.
title: White House Bars Reporter From Event in ‘Gulf of America’ Flap

description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau tapped Kevin Brosseau, a former deputy commissioner of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, as the country’s lead person on fighting fentanyl trafficking.
title: Canada Names Senior Cop as ‘Fentanyl Czar’ in Border Security Crackdown

description: The Trump Justice Department’s order that Manhattan federal prosecutors drop the corruption case against New York Mayor Eric Adams sets up an early showdown over the independence of the government lawyers who police Wall Street.
title: Justice Department’s Adams Order Cues Showdown With Wall Street Prosecutors

description: The US should stop the closure of coal-fired power plants, Energy Secretary Chris Wright said, adding the fuel source would be essential to the nation’s power system for decades to come.
title: US Should Stop Closure of Coal-Fired Power Plants, Wright Says

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Skylar Woodhouse looks at Trump’s remaking of rules for public officials. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Lowers the Guardrails Around Public Officials

description: Apple Inc. is renaming the Gulf of Mexico to Gulf of America on its Maps app, following an executive order signed by US President Donald Trump on his first day in office.
title: Apple Is Renaming Gulf of Mexico to Gulf of America on Maps App

description: President Donald Trump plans to direct agencies to work with Elon Musk’s government cost-cutting effort to slash their workforces, his latest move to gut the federal bureaucracy.
title: Trump to Order Federal Job Cuts as Part of Musk’s Downsizing

description: Citadel founder Ken Griffin said he’s grateful that Elon Musk is taking time away from his companies to slash government spending but offered blunt criticisms of President Donald Trump’s rhetoric on tariffs.
title: Ken Griffin Says ‘Thank You’ to Elon Musk, Attacks Trump Tariffs

description: The US may use “trade tools” to retaliate against European ESG regulations that affect American companies, said Howard Lutnick, who’s US President Donald Trump’s pick to become commerce secretary.
title: Lutnick Is Exploring ‘Trade Tools’ to Target Europe’s ESG Rules

description: An American who has been detained in Russia since 2021 has been freed and is returning home to the US, the White House announced Tuesday.
title: Russia Releases American Teacher as Trump Readies Peace Plan

description: Zimbabwe’s Finance Minister Mthuli Ncube said the southern African nation needs to regain access to credit lines before it can adopt the ZiG as its sole currency.
title: Zimbabwe Isn’t Yet Ready for a Sole Currency, Finance Chief Says

description: A judge in Manhattan agreed that US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent should be allowed to access sensitive federal government payments data during a lawsuit, even as Elon Musk’s government efficiency team will remain locked out for now.
title: Judge Says Treasury Data Limit Applies to DOGE, Not Bessent

description: Rachel Reeves faces a new risk of having to make spending cuts after the UK government’s fiscal watchdog downgraded its growth forecast, leaving Britain’s finance minister scrambling to meet her budgetary rules when a key report is published next month.
title: Reeves Is in the Red After UK Watchdog Downgrades Growth Call

description: A federal judge in Washington ordered the Trump administration to immediately restore certain public health information removed from websites in recent days that doctors and researchers said they needed to treat patients and track disease outbreaks in real time.
title: Trump Administration Ordered to Restore US Health Data Online

description: Peru’s next election is still more than a year away but it’s already worrying investors, with banks now flagging the potential for market volatility ahead.
title: Peru’s Banks Brace for Volatility in Late 2025 as Election Nears

description: President Donald Trump backed off his threat to withhold US aid for Jordan after King Abdullah II agreed during a White House meeting to accept 2,000 ill children from Gaza.
title: Trump Eases Off Aid Threat, Jordan to Take Ill Gaza Children

description: Elon Musk, now President Donald Trump’s most prominent adviser, has increased his attacks on the federal officials and judges he sees as obstacles to his sweeping government cost-cutting crusade.
title: Musk Increases Attacks on Judges Who Rule That DOGE Must Pause

description: For as long as Americans have paid federal income taxes, they’ve been able to subtract some of what they pay to their state and local governments from their taxable income. This federal deduction for state and local taxes — the SALT deduction, for short — has a big influence on how the tax burden is divided. It tends to help taxpayers in wealthier, more urban states, where sales taxes are higher and real estate costs more. President Donald Trump’s 2017 tax law capped the SALT deduction at $10,00
title: What Is SALT, the Tax Deduction Dividing Congress?

description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said he will “welcome Elon” to the Pentagon to “find efficiencies” even as the Trump administration prepares for significant increases in military spending.
title: Hegseth Welcomes Musk to Cut Costs at Pentagon

description: A senior Kremlin envoy said a decision by President Donald Trump’s administration to disband a team overseeing sanctions on Russia for its war on Ukraine may be an early sign the US wants to normalize relations.
title: Putin Envoy Hails US Shutdown of War-Sanctions Task Force

description: President Donald Trump said the Federal Emergency Management Agency should be eliminated, widening his fight against the federal bureaucracy that he has denounced as a “deep state” working against his interests.
title: Trump Calls for Abolishing FEMA, Expanding Battle Against Feds

description: Anduril Industries Inc., a maker of drones and software to control them, will assume management and eventual manufacturing of the US Army’s new infantry goggles from Microsoft Corp., the companies announced Tuesday.
title: Drone Maker Anduril to Take Over Managing Microsoft Goggles for US Army

description: Ford Motor Co. Chief Executive Office Jim Farley will travel to Washington on Wednesday to warn members of Congress that the 25% tariffs President Donald Trump has proposed on Canada and Mexico would “blow a hole” in the US auto industry.
title: Ford’s CEO to Warn Lawmakers of ‘Devastating’ Tariff Impact

description: The US and UK were among countries that declined to sign the final statement released Tuesday from the AI Summit hosted by France that called for promoting international governance over artificial intelligence.
title: US, UK Decline to Sign Onto Macron’s AI Summit Communique

description: Mexico will start consultations with the US government to explain why it considers the steel and aluminum tariffs ordered by President Donald Trump as “not justified,” said Economy Minister Marcelo Ebrard.
title: Mexico to Start Talks With US on Trump’s Steel, Aluminum Tariffs

description: Elizabeth Warren and three other US senators are asking the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp.’s inspector general to probe whether the agency’s decision to rescind more than 200 bank-examiner job offers threatens the stability of the banking system.
title: US Senators Ask FDIC’s Inspector General to Probe Hiring Freeze

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent is set to travel to Ukraine this week as part of initial discussions to secure US access to critical minerals, according to people familiar with the matter who spoke on condition of anonymity.
title: Treasury Secretary Bessent to Visit Kyiv as Trump Seeks Minerals

description: Argentines are spending the most amount of dollars in years as they cash in on a strong peso, stoking further worries over the path of President Javier Milei’s currency policy.
title: Argentines Spend Most Dollars Since 2018 on Strong Peso Policy

description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams should step down after the Trump administration ordered prosecutors to drop their corruption charges against him, City Comptroller Brad Lander said.
title: NYC Mayor Ripped by Rivals as DOJ Pushes to Drop Bribery Charges

description: Romanian prosecutors launched an investigation into the campaign manager of far-right presidential frontrunner Calin Georgescu, whose shock victory led the country’s top court to annul an election on allegations of foreign meddling.
title: Romania Far-Right Candidate’s Campaign Chief Hit by Police Raids

description: A United Nations human rights body called for the immediate release of Nigerien President Mohamed Bazoum, who’s been detained since a 2023 military coup.
title: UN Panel Urges Niger Junta to Release Detained President

description: Jerome Powell Photographer:  Tierney L. Cross/Bloomberg
title: Fed’s Powell Testifies Before Senate on Monetary Policy

description: Iran and Oman’s top military officers met in Tehran for talks to expand and develop defense ties as tensions grow across the Middle East following more than a year of conflict.
title: Iran and Oman Military Chiefs Meet in Tehran For Defense Talks

description: Ecuador’s main socialist party has its best shot of taking power in the Andean nation in nearly a decade. Presidential candidate Luisa González is leading the charge, backed by an experienced political machine and fueled by voter anger.
title: Socialist Leader Nears Power After Tapping Ecuador Voter Anger

description: About 6.3 million barrels of Russia’s Pacific crude are in floating storage
title: Russia's Sakhalin Island Oil Is Backing Up After US Sanctions

description: Russia is in talks to use natural gas to pay for the construction of a nuclear power plant in Turkey, according to people in both countries with knowledge of the matter, as an alternative to cross-border transfers that are being held up by sanctions.
title: Russia, Turkey Discuss Gas Swap to Pay for Delayed Nuclear Plant

description: Rwanda risks an economic backlash over its support for rebels rampaging through neighboring Democratic Republic of Congo.
title: Congo War Fallout Raises Risks for Heavily Indebted Rwanda

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said she believes the UK can strike an agreement with the US to avoid tariffs on steel and aluminum introduced by US President Donald Trump, and suggested also that Britain doesn’t plan to retaliate.
title: Reeves Says UK Sees ‘Deal to Be Done’ With Trump on Steel Levies

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump’s South Africa Bashing Plays Into China’s Hands

description: Big food companies are in RFK Jr.’s crosshairs. Will President Trump’s favorite cuisine soon find itself in the same spot?
title: Why Fast Food Could Be MAHA’s Next Target

description: Argentines support President Javier Milei’s quest to negotiate a free trade agreement with the US, but are split over competing with American firms and are very worried about Donald Trump’s looming tariffs.
title: Argentines Want US Trade Deal Despite Competition, Tariff Fears

description: Latin Americans would broadly support the use of US military force to oust Venezuelan strongman Nicolás Maduro and take on transnational drug cartels, even as they remain largely skeptical of Donald Trump’s return to the White House.
title: Latin Americans Back US Military Force Against Maduro, Poll Says

description: Disapproval of Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva rose for the fifth consecutive time in January amid higher food prices and increasing pessimism about the state of Latin America’s largest economy.
title: Lula Disapproval Jumps Again as Rising Food Costs Hit Brazilians

description: Colombians overwhelmingly disapproved of President Gustavo Petro’s handling of a dispute with Donald Trump over migrants, another blow to the embattled leader who is now less popular in his own country than even his American counterpart.
title: Trump More Popular Than Petro in Colombia After Trade Spat

description: Vice President JD Vance said that the Trump administration will work to make the US the “gold standard worldwide” for artificial intelligence as he issued strong warnings against regulating political speech.
title: Vance Warns Europe Against Over-Regulation of Emerging AI Field

description: Canada’s smaller stocks are holding up better than their larger peers as US President Donald Trump’s trade war shows few signs of slowing.
title: Small Caps in Canada Stand Tall as Traders Brush Off Tariff Risk

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz used his likely final statement in parliament before the election to intensify his attacks on Friedrich Merz, accusing the conservative frontrunner of dividing Europe for political gain and saying his “fickleness and bluster” make him unsuitable to run the country.
title: Scholz Steps Up Attacks on Frontrunner Merz as German Vote Nears

description: The European Union said it will respond to any tariffs the US might impose on it, escalating a potential transatlantic trade dispute.
title: EU Says It Will Impose Countermeasures Against US Tariffs

description: President Donald Trump made it sound logical and straightforward. The US, the most powerful country on Earth, would take over the Gaza Strip after a year and a half of devastating war, remove its damaged buildings and unexploded ordnance, and rebuild the place, Trump said for the first time on Feb. 4. Meanwhile, he said, Gazans should be taken in by neighboring countries and given access to lives so “beautiful” they wouldn’t want to return.
title: A US Takeover of an Emptied Gaza? Why Trump’s Proposal Is Shocking

description: Efforts by the South African authorities to combat corruption appear to have stagnated and the country remains below the global average on an index that measures perceptions of graft, according to advocacy group Corruption Watch.
title: Anti-Corruption Efforts in South Africa Stagnate, Group Says

description: French unemployment unexpectedly declined at the end of 2024, showing signs of economic resilience in a country wrestling with political instability and rising debt.
title: French Unemployment Decline Eases Concerns on Economic Outlook

description: Russia targeted Ukrainian gas and power facilities in strikes overnight and early Tuesday as night temperatures in Ukraine fell below minus 10C (14F).
title: Ukraine Says Russia Targeted Gas Facilities in Overnight Attack

description: China plans to roll out a network of tourist trains equipped with medical and elder-care facilities as part of its efforts to create a “silver economy” and unlock the spending power of its aging population.
title: China Plans ‘Silver Trains’ to Encourage Aging Boomers to Travel

description: The Philippines and Cambodia pledged to fight cross-border crimes as both Southeast Asian nations grapple with scam centers and human trafficking.
title: Philippines, Cambodia Vow to Fight Transnational Crimes

description: Australia needs to carefully manage ties with its biggest trading partner, China, and No. 1 investor and key ally, the US, as the world’s two largest economies face off, the head of the Australian Chamber of Commerce and Institute said.
title: Australia Must Tread Warily in Any US-China Standoff, ACCI Says

description: While US President Donald Trump’s plan to impose 25% tariffs on steel and aluminum imports may be good news for investors, it’s unlikely to arrest decades of declining market share and stagnating production.
title: Trump Steel Tariff Redux Spells Relief But Not Revival

description: Economists at global banks from Morgan Stanley to Nomura Holdings Inc. have identified India and Thailand as among the nations most exposed to risks from President Donald Trump’s vow to impose reciprocal tariffs on trading partners.
title: Trump’s Eye-for-Eye Tariff Threat Puts India, Thailand at Risk

description: President Donald Trump said he wants to increase the amount of money for the US military, a goal that runs counter to efforts from his top ally — Elon Musk — to slash trillions of dollars of federal spending.
title: Trump Wants More Military Money as DOGE Eyes Big Cuts Elsewhere

description: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto doubled down on a push to slash spending and reallocate funds to his signature social programs, criticizing opposition from “little kings” even as concerns rise that the cuts could prove a drag on Southeast Asia’s largest economy.
title: Prabowo Slams ‘Little Kings’ as Indonesian Budget Pushback Grows

description: President Donald Trump has fired the head of the federal Office of Government Ethics, which oversees disclosure and potential conflicts of interest involving top government officials, according to a post on the agency’s blog.
title: Trump Fires Top Ethics Official Overseeing Conflicts of Interest

description: President Donald Trump said he has spoken with Chinese President Xi Jinping since his Jan. 20 inauguration, amid a brewing trade war between the two nations.
title: Trump Says He Spoke With Xi Since Inauguration, Unclear When

description: The Justice Department has told prosecutors in the Southern District of New York to drop the case against Mayor Eric Adams, according to a memo obtained by Bloomberg Law.
title: DOJ Tells Prosecutors to Drop Mayor Eric Adams Corruption Case

description: Behind the display of solidarity with Palestinians lies a concern over the security and stability of a vulnerable Middle East.
title: Spooked Arab World Scrambles for Response to Trump’s Gaza Plan

description: The Trump administration’s push to shutter the agency means it's unable to warn the US military where aid workers are operating
title: USAID Shutdown Imperils Humanitarian Convoys in Conflict Zones
